arts.ttl: Wolves manager fumes at players for ignoring his instructions in Bournemouth defeat
arts.sum: Vitor Pereira advised his team to exploit the flanks against Bournemouth but they fell behind to Marcus Tavernier’s deflected fourth-minute strike after losing possession while attempting to play through the middle

arts.ttl: Bournemouth edge past Wolves for first win
arts.sum: A deflected Marcus Tavernier strike earns Bournemouth their first win of the season at Vitality Stadium as Wolves suffer back-to-back losses.

arts.ttl: Wolves issue Jorgen Strand Larsen update after being spotted ‘frustrated’ vs Bournemouth
arts.sum: Following the match between Wolves and Bournemouth, Vitor Pereira was asked during his post-match press conference about the reaction of Jorgen Strand Larsen when he was substituted. After clearing up the source of Strand Larsen’s frustration, Pereira clarified that although he was in pain, they weren’t overly concerned about it.

arts.ttl: Vitor Pereira says Wolves players did not follow gameplan in loss at Bournemouth
arts.sum: Wolves suffered a second successive defeat this term following a 4-0 hammering at home to Manchester City.

Wolves were better throughout the second half, but had to play the majority of it with 10 men after captain Toti Gomes was given a straight red card. A dangerous Brooks cross then set up Semenyo from five yards at the far post and when it was harder to miss, the forward somehow knocked the ball onto the crossbar and failed to double Bournemouth's lead.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth's win against 10-man Wolves was uncomfortable - Iraola
arts.sum: Bournemouth manager Adoni Iraola says his side's victory against Wolverhampton Wanderers was "uncomfortable" after The Cherries missed chances to seal the game after the visitors went down to 10 men.

arts.ttl: Marcus Tavernier’s goal gets Bournemouth up and running with win over Wolves
arts.sum: The goal owed a little to good fortune.

arts.ttl: Brentford v Aston Villa, Bournemouth v Wolves, Burnley v Sunderland: football – live
arts.sum: Updates from 3pm BST kick-offs across the grounds Live scoreboard | Mail John via email | City v Spurs live Burnley v Sunderland teams Burnley: Dubravka, Walker, Esteve, Ekdal, Hartman, Bruun Larsen, Cullen, Ugochukwu, Hannibal, Anthony, Foster. Subs: Weiss, Worrall, Edwards, Tchaouna, Flemming, Ramsey, Sonne, Pires, Laurent. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Gary Lineker explains why he thinks Wolves will lose to Bournemouth
arts.sum: Gary Lineker explains why he thinks Bournemouth will win against Wolves Lineker was critical of Vitor Pereira’s tactical approach in the season opener against Man City, and he, like us, will be hoping to see a more attacking lineup for this Bournemouth game .

arts.ttl: A clear sign that Wolves have an incredible chance of getting a result vs Bournemouth
arts.sum: Wolves have the chance to pick up their first points of the Premier League season when they take on Bournemouth this weekend and a streak that they are on points to this being a great opportunity. Wolves have never lost away to Bournemouth in the Premier League
